intro: Dalechampia roezliana, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences, typically surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Dalechampia roezliana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
